item.title: sara add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "He knew only that his child was his warrant. He said: If he is not the word of God God never spoke." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: sara add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: sara add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "You do not have to be good. You do not have to walk on your knees for a hundred miles through the desert, repenting. You only have to let the soft animal of your body love what it loves. Tell me about despair, yours, and I will tell you mine. Meanwhile the world goes on. Meanwhile the sun and the clear pebbles of the rain are moving across the landscapes, over the prairies and the deep trees, the mountains and the rivers. Meanwhile the wild geese, high in the clean blue air, are heading home again. Whoever you are, no matter how lonely, the world offers itself to your imagination, calls to you like the wild geese, harsh and exciting â€“ over and over announcing your place in the family of things." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: sara add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Instructions for living a life. Pay attention. Be astonished. Tell about it." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: sara add a quote by Clarissa Pinkola Estes
item.description: "Asking the proper question is the central action of transformation- in fairy tales, in analysis, and in individuation. The key question causes germination of consciousness. The properly shaped question always emanates from an essential curiosity about what stands behind. Questions are the keys that cause the secret doors of the psyche to swing open." -- Clarissa Pinkola Estes

item.title: sara add a quote by Audrey Hepburn
item.description: "The beauty of a woman is not in the clothes she wears, the figure that she carries, or the way she combs her hair. The beauty of a woman is seen in her eyes, because that is the doorway to her heart, the place where love resides. True beauty in a woman is reflected in her soul. It's the caring that she lovingly gives, the passion that she shows & the beauty of a woman only grows with passing years." -- Audrey Hepburn

item.title: sara add a quote by pleasefindthis
item.description: "Be soft. Do not let the world make you hard. Do not let pain make you hate. Do not let the bitterness steal your sweetness. Take pride that even though the rest of the world may disagree, you still believe it to be a beautiful place." -- pleasefindthis

item.title: sara add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "What is that you express in your eyes? It seems to me more than all the print I have read in my life." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: sara add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Not I, nor anyone else can travel that road for you. You must travel it by yourself. It is not far. It is within reach. Perhaps you have been on it since you were born, and did not know. Perhaps it is everywhere - on water and land." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: sara add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "God is a mean-spirited, pugnacious bully bent on revenge against His children for failing to live up to his impossible standards." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: sara add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Life has no meaning. Each of us has meaning and we bring it to life. It is a waste to be asking the question when you are the answer." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: sara add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: sara add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "I tell you this to break your heart, by which I mean only that it break open and never close again to the rest of the world." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: sara add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Ten times a day something happens to me like this - some strengthening throb of amazement - some good sweet empathic ping and swell. This is the first, the wildest and the wisest thing I know: that the soul exists and is built entirely out of attentiveness." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: sara add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "So every day So every day I was surrounded by the beautiful crying forth of the ideas of God, one of which was you." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: sara add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "I read the way a person might swim, to save his or her life. I wrote that way too." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: sara add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description:
"<b>The Uses Of Sorrow</b>
(In my sleep I dreamed this poem)
Someone I loved once gave me a box full of darkness.
It took me years to understand that this, too, was a gift." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: sara add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "I held my breath as we do sometimes to stop time when something wonderful has touched us..." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: sara add a quote by Mary Oliver White Heron Rises Over Blackwater
item.description: "He is exactly the poem I wanted to write." -- Mary Oliver White Heron Rises Over Blackwater

item.title: sara add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description:
"Love, love, love, says Percy. And hurry as fast as you can along the shining beach, or the rubble, or the dust.
Then, go to sleep. Give up your body heat, your beating heart. Then, trust." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: sara add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "It's not a competition, it's a doorway." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: sara add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description:
"There are things you canâ€™t reach. But You can reach out to them, and all day long.
The wind, the bird flying away. The idea of god.
And it can keep you busy as anything else, and happier.
I look; morning to night I am never done with looking.
Looking I mean not just standing around, but standing around As though with your arms open." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: sara add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "When itâ€™s over, I want to say: All my life I was a bride married to amazement. I was the bridegroom, taking the world into my arms." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: sara add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description:
"When
When itâ€™s over, itâ€™s over, and we donâ€™t know any of us, what happens then. So I try not to miss anything. I think, in my whole life, I have never missed The full moon or the slipper of its coming back. Or, a kiss. Well, yes, especially a kiss." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: sara add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "If you suddenly and unexpectedly feel joy, donâ€™t hesitate. Give in to it." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: sara add a quote by Julia Quinn
item.description: "In her heart she longed for this man, dreamed of a life that could never be." -- Julia Quinn

item.title: sara add a quote by Julia Quinn
item.description:
"It suddenly made sense. Only twice in his life had he felt this inexplicable, almost mystical attraction to a woman. Heâ€™d thought it remarkable, to have found two, when in his heart heâ€™d always believed there was only one perfect woman out there for him.
His heart had been right. There was only one." -- Julia Quinn

item.title: sara add a quote by C. JoyBell C.
item.description: "Sometimes the things that are felt the most are expressed between two souls over the distance and over time...where no words abide. And others may speak freely, live with one another freely, express themselves freelyâ€“ just like everyone else, but then there is you... you have no words for proof of reassurance, no tokens of professed love, but you have something. Something worth keeping." -- C. JoyBell C.

item.title: sara add a quote by Andrew Davidson
item.description: "If you listen to the wind very carefully, you'll be able to hear me whisper my love for you." -- Andrew Davidson

item.title: sara add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I imagine a line, a white line, painted on the sand and on the ocean, from me to you." -- Jonathan Safran Foer
